instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2936: What is 820-2936? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B no data on one of the USB ports
threads.message: It is the second port closest to the DPort connector I get light on extern disk but no data (blinking light)..any ideas?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B no data on one of the USB ports
threads.message: Check L4610 (continuity test) and measure in diode mode both data lines...

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B no data on one of the USB ports
threads.message:
[QUOTE="aprendiz, post: 4579"]Check L4610 (continuity test) and measure in diode mode both data lines...[/QUOTE]

excuse my ignorence her but from which point to which point should i check continuity?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B no data on one of the USB ports
threads.message: L4610, should be continuity between pins 1-2 and 3-4

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B no data on one of the USB ports
threads.message:
[QUOTE="aprendiz, post: 4598"]L4610, should be continuity between pins 1-2 and 3-4[/QUOTE]
no continuity between them

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B no data on one of the USB ports
threads.message: L4610 Replaced and bingo! thanks alot I love this forum!
